# Recipe: Crockpot Sausage and Lentil Soup

## Introduction
Crockpot Sausage and Lentil Soup is a hearty and flavorful dish that combines the richness of sausage with the earthiness of lentils. This soup is perfect for chilly days and can be easily prepared in a slow cooker, allowing the flavors to meld together beautifully.

## Ingredients
- 1 pound Italian sausage, casings removed
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 carrots, diced
- 2 celery stalks, diced
- 3 cloves of garlic, minced
- 1 cup dried lentils, rinsed
- 4 cups chicken broth
- 1 can (14.5 ounces) diced tomatoes, undrained
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- Salt and pepper to taste

## Equipment
- Slow cooker
- Cutting board
- Knife
- Wooden spoon

## Preparation Time
- 15 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 6 hours on low heat or 3 hours on high heat

## Steps
1. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add the Italian sausage. Cook until browned and crumbled, breaking it up with a wooden spoon as it cooks.
2. Transfer the cooked sausage to the slow cooker.
3. In the same skillet, add the chopped onion, diced carrots, diced celery, and minced garlic. Cook for about 5 minutes until the vegetables start to soften.
4. Add the cooked vegetables to the slow cooker.
5. Rinse the dried lentils under cold water and add them to the slow cooker.
6. Pour in the chicken broth and diced tomatoes with their juice.
7. Add the dried thyme, dried oregano, salt, and pepper to the slow cooker. Stir everything together.
8. Cover the slow cooker and cook on low heat for 6 hours or on high heat for 3 hours, until the lentils are tender.
9. Before serving, taste and adjust the seasoning if needed.
10. Serve hot and enjoy!

## Serving Suggestions
- Serve the Crockpot Sausage and Lentil Soup with crusty bread for dipping.
- Top each bowl with a dollop of sour cream or a sprinkle of grated Parmesan cheese for added creaminess.

## Variations
- For a vegetarian version, omit the sausage and use vegetable broth instead of chicken broth. Add extra vegetables like bell peppers or zucchini for added flavor and texture.
- Add a handful of fresh spinach or kale to the soup during the last 15 minutes of cooking for added nutritional value.

## Tips and Tricks
- If you prefer a smoother texture, you can blend a portion of the soup using an immersion blender or a regular blender.
- If the soup becomes too thick while cooking, you can add more chicken broth or water to thin it out.
- This soup freezes well, so you can make a larger batch and freeze individual portions for later use.

## Nutritional Information
- Serving Size: 1 cup
- Calories: 300
- Fat: 15g
- Carbohydrates: 25g
- Protein: 18g

## Storage and Leftovers
- Store any leftovers of the Crockpot Sausage and Lentil Soup in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
- Reheat the soup on the stovetop or in the microwave until heated through before serving.

## Frequently Asked Questions
Q: Can I use pre-cooked sausage in this recipe?
A: Yes, you can use pre-cooked sausage if you prefer. Simply slice the sausage into bite-sized pieces and add them to the slow cooker along with the other ingredients.

Q: Can I use canned lentils instead of dried lentils?
A: While dried lentils are recommended for this recipe, you can use canned lentils if you're short on time. Just be sure to drain and rinse the canned lentils before adding them to the slow cooker. Adjust the cooking time accordingly, as canned lentils do not require as much time to cook.

Q: Can I make this soup on the stovetop instead of using a slow cooker?
A: Absolutely! Follow the same steps, but instead of transferring everything to a slow cooker, simmer the soup on the stovetop over low heat for about 1 hour, or until the lentils are tender. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.

Q: Can I freeze the leftovers?
A: Yes, this soup freezes well. Allow the soup to cool completely before transferring it to freezer-safe containers or bags. Label the containers with the date and freeze for up to 3 months. Thaw in the refrigerator overnight before reheating.
